title: 10 bold predictions for the 2025 Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye, a 2024 NFL Draft pick, is key for the Patriots' playoff hopes with predictions of 30 total touchdowns.
TreVeyon Henderson, drafted from Ohio State, is expected to surpass 1,000 rushing yards and make significant contributions.
The Patriots forecast an 8-9 record in 2025, striving to recover from consecutive four-win seasons under new coach Mike Vrabel.

title: Tom Brady ‘was supposed’ to play for Raiders upon leaving Patriots, Las Vegas owner Mark Davis said
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady was nearly signed by the Las Vegas Raiders in 2020, but the team chose a different direction.
Brady became a minority owner of the Raiders in May 2023 after retiring from the NFL.
The NFL has amended broadcast restrictions for Brady, allowing him to attend FOX production meetings.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: "Friendship," featuring Tim Robinson and Paul Rudd, is streaming on HBO Max as a suburban dad befriends his cool neighbor.
"Highest 2 Lowest," a Spike Lee and Denzel Washington collaboration, is available on Apple TV+ as a hostage crisis thriller.
Disney's live-action remake of "Lilo & Stitch" has grossed over a billion dollars and is streaming on Disney+.

title: What Jakobi Meyers and the Raiders are saying about the Patriots ahead of season opener
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers, former Patriot, is set to play against New England as a wide receiver for the Raiders on Sunday.
Raiders head coach Pete Carroll highlighted Patriots' running game and formidable front seven as significant challenges.
Meyers addressed his trade request's uncertainty, emphasizing his commitment to his Raiders teammates and the upcoming game.

title: Jaylen Brown gives his own take on Boston Tea Party in stream with IShowSpeed
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown streamed a live tour of Boston with YouTuber IShowSpeed, featuring a Boston Tea Party reenactment.
Brown and IShowSpeed engaged in activities including dumping tea overboard and racing at Downtown Crossing.
After the race, Brown jokingly disputed IShowSpeed's win, suggesting he change his name on social media.

title: Dante Scarnecchia likes what he sees from Patriots rookie Will Campbell
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Will Campbell, Patriots' rookie left tackle, will debut against the Raiders, barring an ankle injury setback.
Dante Scarnecchia praises Campbell's dynamic run blocking, finishing skills, and competitive motor during training camp.
Despite concerns about his arm length, Campbell received high grades for pass and run blocking in preseason by PFF.

title: ‘That’s their prerogative’: Mike Vrabel responds to Bill Belichick’s ban on Patriots scouts at UNC
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Mike Vrabel addressed the ban on Patriots scouts by UNC coach Bill Belichick, calling it an 'individual choice.'
The ban is reportedly due to a strained relationship between Belichick and Patriots owner Robert Kraft after Belichick's firing.
Patriots scouts must rely on requesting film and calling UNC for player information due to the ban on attending games.

title: Woman who was allegedly filmed in the shower at URI is suing the school
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A University of Rhode Island student, Jane Doe, is suing URI for negligence after allegedly being filmed in a unisex shower.
James Paquette, identified by the plaintiff, faces charges of video voyeurism for allegedly filming the student in April 2025.
The lawsuit accuses URI of defamation and failure to provide adequate security, impacting the student's academic and personal life.

title: Christian Gonzalez to miss Patriots’ season opener, Will Campbell questionable vs. Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Christian Gonzalez will miss Patriots' season opener against the Raiders due to a hamstring injury.
Rookie left tackle Will Campbell is questionable with an ankle injury for the game on Sunday.
Cornerback Alex Austin, Marcus Jones, and Carlton Davis are set to play in Gonzalez's absence.

title: Jayson Tatum’s Celtics teammate has a positive update on star’s recovery from Achilles tear
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum is progressing well in his recovery from a ruptured Achilles tendon, according to teammate Jordan Walsh.
The Celtics have not set a timeline for Tatum's return, focusing on his full health before he resumes play.
Tatum has been walking without a boot and has been a regular at the Celtics practice facility this summer.
